meanings.def: talking very loudly, too much and in a way that is annoying
too bright and not showing good taste
examples: He wore a loud checked jacket and a green tie.

meanings.def: in a way that makes a lot of noise or can be easily heard
examples: Do you have to play that music so loud?
You'll have to speak louder—I can't hear you.
She screamed loud enough to wake the dead.
If you shout loud enough, you will get what you want.
The audience laughed loudly at the joke.
Don’t play your music too loud.
I shouted as loud as I could.
Can you speak louder?
Can you read the letter out loud?
He laughed out loud at his own joke.

meanings.def: what a person actually does means more than what they say they will do
used to show you are angry or surprised
examples: For crying out loud! Why did you have to do that?

meanings.def: in a way that is very easy to understand
examples: The message is coming through loud and clear.

meanings.def: in a voice that can be heard by other people
examples: I laughed out loud.
Please read the letter out loud.

meanings.def: to say what your thoughts are as you have them
